RLO: Define and explain the notion of an algorithm
SLO: Understand the implementation, complexity analysis, and applications of fundamental algorithms such as max flow and linear programming

RLO: Explain what is meant by an efficient algorithm
SLO: Analyse and use some fundamental data structures, such as binary search trees and disjoint sets

RLO: Define and explain (on an intuitive level) the time and space complexity of an algorithm
SLO: Have some familiarity with randomized algorithms, approximation algorithms, and fixed-parameter algorithms

RLO: Use algorithms learned in lectures to solve interesting problems in lab sessions
Differentiate between elegant and inelegant algorithms
